result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston A Fletcher

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Preston A Fletcher
Current: 7224 North Clairemont Street, Chicago, IL 60659 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2022)
Prior: 3819 W Gladys Ave #2, Chicago, IL 60624

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:36 PM Defendant Preston A Fletcher in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Preston A Fletcher.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Berg is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to making contact w/ a residence in Nekoosa. Testifies to an incident that happened earlier that day. Testifies to making contact w/ Austin G. Testifies to smelling marijuana and Austin stating he smoked before coming outside. Testifies to stating other individuals weren't home, then stated they were home. Testifies to a search warrant being drafted and a search being conducted. Testifies to Preston Fletcher being searched first and what substances were found on him. Testifies to a search being conducted on Leo Cloud. Testifies to the substances being tested and the results. Testifies to identifying who the rooms belonged to. Testifies to locating a wallet w/ Preston Fletcher's ID and a rolled up dollar bill that had substances on it. Testifies to dog medications being labeled as to Leo Cloud. Testifies to what was found in the rooms. Testifies to finding jars w/ bags of marijuana in them. Testifies to drug paraphernalia that was found. Testifies to testing the marijuana that was found and the results. Witness identifies Leo Cloud in court, court recognizes. Witness identifies Preston Fletcher in court, court recognizes. 

Attorney Zamzow cross examines the witness. Witness testifies to only finding a wallet that belonged to Fletcher. 
Attorney Zima gives an additional statement regarding the search that was conducted.
Attorney Zamzow gives an argument stating there isn't probable cause to bind this matter over.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on August 5, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
9:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Preston A Fletcher in court.  Transferred to Br 3.
Search Warrant, Complaint for Search Warrant; Return of Officer
No contact with L.C, S.J., A.G. or their residences. Absolute sobriety, No controlled substances without a valid prescription. NKPD 22-1409
No contact w/ co-defendants or their residences - LC, SJ, and AG. Absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
